title: Yes Bank and Indiabulls Tanked in Yesterday’s Trade, while Airtel Made Smart Gains
text:
Yesterday we observed a very stock specific movement as the broader index declined by a minor 0.33% in yesterday’s trade. Banking stocks, in particular, took a big hit, with Nifty Bank index falling by 2.6% and Nifty PSU Bank index declining by an even bigger 3.5%.

There was a spate of bad news engulfing the banking sector mainly due to its exposure to the real estate sector. It started with Indiabulls (NS: ) shares declining by a whopping 34% yesterday after reports of accounting irregularities and siphoning off of own funds by the owners. Lakshmi Vilas Bank also declined by 5% as the RBI initiated prompt corrective action on the bank. Incidentally, LVLS is planning to merge with Indiabulls.

Investors’ sentiments in the banking sector have already been soured by the news that after RBI reported that over two-thirds of the Punjab and Maharashtra Co-operative Bank's assets were exposed to debt-ridden Housing Development (NS: ) and Infrastructure Ltd.

Yes Bank (NS: ) continued with its free-fall as the stock declined by a staggering 15% in yesterday’s trade. There is a fear among investors that Yes Bank’s outstanding exposure to real-estate companies like Indiabulls could further hurt the bank in the coming days. The stock tanked despite the news that RBI gave Yes Bank the permission to raise additional capital.

Talking about some positive news, Airtel’s stock was up by 5% in yesterday’s trade on the news that it is exploring the option of selling its stake in tower infrastructure business to PE firms. This stake sale will help Airtel to raise funds to deleverage its balance sheet while it will also allow it to focus on its wireless business, especially the upcoming 5G technology.

Talking about today, Nifty may come under pressure as the eight-core infrastructure index declined by 0.5% for the month of September. This metric had expanded by 4.7% in August, which indicates that it was a mere blip.
